*div1 type="summary"* *p*Austin to Samuel M. Williams, Saltillo, April 30, 1831. The legislature has done no harm. Hopes of reform in visit to Teran, */p* */div1*
*div1 type="body"*
*p*[From Williams Papers, Rosenberg Library, Galveston, Tex.]*/p*
*p**date_mentioned n="04-30-1831">April 30/31*/date_mentioned**/p* *p*Dr Sir.*/p*
*p*I have only time to say that the Session is closed (thank God) for this year—no harm has been done, which is saying a great deal for such a body as this has been. I think that some good will be effected *date_mentioned n="xx-xx-1832">next year.*/date_mentioned**/p*
*p*The points you speak of as to locating *location_mentioned*low down on Colorado*/location_mentioned*, and to *person_mentioned*Mexicans */person_mentioned*must remain untill I get home—do nothing with them at all.*/p*
*p*The *location_mentioned*Trinity */location_mentioned*affair is at last beginning to make a proper impression on the mind of the *person_mentioned*Govr*/person_mentioned*. and I am more pleased with him than I was—I think he will take [a] stand.*/p*
*p*I go to *location_mentioned*Matamoros*/location_mentioned*, and have strong hopes of a favourable result tho I have doubts. They will be all removed one way or the other in a *date_mentioned n="05-xx-1831">month */date_mentioned*more.*/p*
*p*The clock is striking 8 which is the hour of closing the mail so remember to all and farewell.*/p*
*p**person_mentioned*S F Austin*/person_mentioned**/p*
*p*I leave *date_mentioned n="05-08-1831">next Sunday*/date_mentioned*, that is tomorrow week for *location_mentioned*Matamoros */location_mentioned*in company wTith *person_mentioned*Chambers*/person_mentioned**/p*
*p*[Addressed:] Al *person_mentioned*Sor Sam. M. Williams admor. de correos en la villa de *location_mentioned*Austin*/location_mentioned**/person_mentioned*.*/p*
*/div1*
